fields.name: node
fields.description: Fetches an object given its ID

types.name: Viewer
types.description: The viewer of the GraphQL server

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of an object

fields.name: magineId
fields.description: use this id for urls and presentation

fields.name: userId
fields.description: User id, or null if not logged in

fields.name: resellerBranding
fields.description: reseller branding settings if exists

fields.name: isAuthenticated
fields.description: Is user logged in

fields.name: hasActiveParentalControl
fields.description: Does the user have activated Parental Control

fields.name: hasParentalControlPinCode
fields.description: Does the user have a PIN code for Parental Control

fields.name: canEditParentalControl
fields.description: Is the user allowed to modify parental control settings?

fields.name: view
fields.description: use this to fetch one specific View

fields.name: block
fields.description: use this to fetch specific block

fields.name: viewable
fields.description: use this to fetch specific viewable

args.name: magineId
args.description: the viewable id, often uuid but can be numerics as well

fields.name: viewableCustomId
fields.description: use this to fetch specific viewable with custom id

args.name: customId
args.description: A custom id usually human readable for viewables

fields.name: search
fields.description: use this to search viewables

args.name: kinds
args.description: a comma separated list of kinds, the following are supported: movie, episode, show, program, clip and channel'

fields.name: entitlements
fields.description: List of entitlements for user. Empty if user is not authenticated, can be checked using viewer.isAuthenticated.

fields.name: offer
fields.description: use this to fetch specific offer by id

args.name: offerId
args.description: The id of offer. Allows to fetch any offer including hidden ones

fields.name: offers
fields.description: List of offers available for purchase by user. If authenticated user it will use country of user to fetch the list else it will use GeoIP country. Deprecation note: please do not use to fetch third party offers: use thirdPartyOffers instead.

fields.name: thirdPartyOffers
fields.description: List of third party offers. Restricted to the ones available for purchase (i.e. only the active offers, and, if a user is authenticated, to the offers not already purchased).

fields.name: subscriptions
fields.description: List of subscriptions for a user. Empty if user is not authenticated, can be checked using viewer.isAuthenticated.

fields.name: campaign

args.name: promoCode
args.description: A promoCode to get the connected Campaign

fields.name: promoCodeAppliedPreview

args.name: promoCode
args.description: A promoCode to get the connected Campaign

args.name: offerId
args.description: If provided, checks that promo code campaign can be applied to this offer. If omitted, checks that user is entitled to an offer which is connected to the campaign

fields.name: paymentHistory
fields.description: The user's payment history

fields.name: adyenDropInPaymentMethods
fields.description: Fields for initializing Adyen Checkout

args.name: offerId
args.description: If provided, returns Adyen payment methods based on offer price and currency. If omitted, returns payment methods based only on user country. It should be omitted only when changing payment method without a purchase.

args.name: originalOfferId
args.description: If provided together with offerId, returns Adyen payment methods based on a price of upgrade from originalOfferId to offerId

args.name: promoCode
args.description: If provided, returns Adyen payment methods based on offer reduced price and currency

types.name: Node
types.description: An object with an ID

fields.name: id
fields.description: The id of the object.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: ResellerBranding
types.description: Reseller branding configurations

types.name: Logo
types.description: Branding logo(s)

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

fields.name: hasPreviousPage
fields.description: When paginating backwards, are there more items?

fields.name: startCursor
fields.description: When paginating backwards, the cursor to continue.

fields.name: endCursor

types.name: Channel
types.description: Channel viewable

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of an object

fields.name: magineId
fields.description: use this id for urls and presentation

fields.name: entitlement
fields.description:
Entitlement returns available entitlements for this viewable.

If the user is not authenticated it will always return null. You can use the viewer.isAuthenticated to check in the response from GraphQL.

fields.name: linkedViewables
fields.description:
A list of linked viewables

Important note: This should not be queried from a collection view but instead used only on detail pages. If you are using this, there is no need to also query for trailers, as the same information is available in this one.

fields.name: image
fields.description:
An image URL.

If no parameters are specified an image marked as default in the metadata will be picked. If no image is marked as default the first image in the list will be returned. In the case of no images available null is returned.

If type is specified, it will pick an image with the specified type and if no match is found null is returned.

fields.name: broadcastById
fields.description: A broadcast

fields.name: broadcastsFromLive
fields.description: A list of broadcasts starting from the currently live broadcast (currently only support size 1 or 2).

args.name: size
args.description: optionally how many broadcasts from live to fetch

fields.name: broadcasts
fields.description: Get broadcasts for channel by day. If no day is provided it will default to today in UTC.

fields.name: collections
fields.description:
Linked collections

A set of collections related to the viewable.
Important note: This should not be queried from a collection view, but instead used only on detail pages.

fields.name: related
fields.description: This attribute fetches related viewables based on attributes of the viewable. It should not be called for collections as it could be rejected because of high complexity. It should instead be called for views that render an individual viewable and the related viewables, e.g a detail page

fields.name: tagsToRender
fields.description: Contains a list of tags to render about the viewable and if they are searchable or not.

fields.description: The ID of an object

If no parameters are specified an image marked as default in the metadata will be picked. If no image is marked as default the first image in the list will be returned. In the case of no images available null is returned.

If type is specified, it will pick an image with the specified type and if no match is found null is returned.

types.name: OfferType
types.description: Offer Type

enumValues.name: BUY
enumValues.description: Electronic sell-through (EST) offer, no explicit time limit on ownership. Offer is a one-off transaction.

enumValues.name: RENT
enumValues.description: Rental offer, time limited window of ownership. Offer is a one-off transaction.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIBE
enumValues.description: Subscription offer. Offer is a recurring transaction with a defined period, e.g. monthly or yearly.

enumValues.name: PASS
enumValues.description: Pass offer.

enumValues.name: DEFAULT
enumValues.description: Default offer.

enumValues.name: THIRDPARTY
enumValues.description: ThirdParty offer.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: BroadcastPlayable
types.description: Playable broadcast

fields.name: id
fields.description: use this id for urls and presentation

fields.name: startTimeUtc
fields.description: Start time utc in seconds

types.name: BuyType
types.description: This is the buy option for viewable/s

fields.name: priceInCents
fields.description: Price in cents for the offer option

fields.name: currency
fields.description: Currency for the offer option

fields.name: purchaseAvailableUntil
fields.description: Offer is available until this date, format is in ISO-8601, if not set the offer is available indefinitely

fields.name: decorationText
fields.description: Text describing the type of offer

fields.name: buttonText
fields.description: Text to display on the the offer button

fields.name: image
fields.description:
An image URL.

If no parameters are specified an image marked as default in the metadata will be picked. If no image is marked as default the first image in the list will be returned. In the case of no images available null is returned.

If type is specified, it will pick an image with the specified type and if no match is found null is returned.

types.name: ChannelPlayable
types.description: Playable channel

fields.name: id
fields.description: use this id for urls and presentation

types.name: DefaultType
types.description: A free offer that users get automatically entitled to.

fields.name: image
fields.description:
An image URL.

If no parameters are specified an image marked as default in the metadata will be picked. If no image is marked as default the first image in the list will be returned. In the case of no images available null is returned.

If type is specified, it will pick an image with the specified type and if no match is found null is returned.

types.name: EntitlementBuyType
types.description: This is a bought entitlement.

types.name: EntitlementDefaultType
types.description: This is a default entitlement.

types.name: EntitlementPassType
types.description: This is a pass entitlement.

fields.name: entitledUntil
fields.description: The user is entitled to this until this datetime, format is in ISO-8601. If not set, indefinitely.

fields.name: expiresInSeconds
fields.description: How soon the entitlement expires in seconds. If not present, entitlement never expires.

types.name: EntitlementPurchaseType
types.description: DEPRECATED: Use EntitlementBuyType!

fields.name: purchasedAt
fields.description: Offer was purchased at this datetime, format is in ISO-8601.

types.name: EntitlementRentType
types.description: This is a rented entitlement.

fields.name: entitledUntil
fields.description: The user is entitled to this until this datetime, format is in ISO-8601. If not set, indefinitely.

fields.name: expiresInSeconds
fields.description: How soon the entitlement expires in seconds. If not present, entitlement never expires.

types.name: EntitlementThirdPartyType
types.description: This is a thirdParty entitlement.

fields.name: entitledUntil
fields.description: The user is entitled to this until this datetime, format is in ISO-8601. If not set, indefinitely.

fields.name: expiresInSeconds
fields.description: How soon the entitlement expires in seconds. If not present, entitlement never expires.

types.name: LanguageTrack
types.description: Language code and type for specific subtitle track. These values are not translated and not polished into human friendly values. New values might also begin to appear without any notifications in advance

fields.name: language
fields.description: 3 letter ISO language code

fields.name: subtitleType
fields.description: Specifies what type of subtitle this is. Currently available types: normal.

fields.name: purchaseAvailableUntil
fields.description: Offer is available until this date, format is in ISO-8601, if not set the offer is available indefinitely

fields.name: decorationText
fields.description: Text describing the type of offer

fields.name: buttonText

fields.name: entitlementDurationSec

types.name: ThirdPartyType
types.description: This is the buy option for viewable/s.

fields.name: subtype
fields.description: The type of the 3rd party offer, i.e. 'subscription', 'est', 'rental', 'pass' or 'outsourced'.

fields.name: externalOfferId
fields.description: The id of the offer in the external store or in the partner's backend.

fields.name: providerName
fields.description: The name of the provider, e.g. GOOGLE, APPLE, A-CUSTOM-PROVIDER.

fields.name: purchaseAvailableUntil
fields.description: Offer is available for purchase until this date, format is in ISO-8601, if not set the offer is available for purchase indefinitely

fields.name: entitlementDurationSec
fields.description: The number of seconds a user will be entitled to the content.

fields.description:

If type is specified, it will pick an image with the specified type and if no match is found null is returned.

types.name: Episode
types.description: Episode viewable

fields.name: id
fields.description: The ID of an object

fields.name: magineId
fields.description: use this id for urls and presentation

fields.name: entitlement
fields.description:
Entitlement returns available entitlements for this viewable.

If the user is not authenticated it will always return null. You can use the viewer.isAuthenticated to check in the response from GraphQL.

fields.name: linkedViewables
fields.description:
A list of linked viewables

Important note: This should not be queried from a collection view but instead used only on detail pages. If you are using this, there is no need to also query for trailers, as the same information is available in this one.

fields.name: trailers
fields.description:
A list of trailers

Important note: This should not be queried from a collection view but instead used only on detail pages.

fields.name: image
fields.description:
An image URL.

If no parameters are specified an image marked as default in the metadata will be picked. If no image is marked as default the first image in the list will be returned. In the case of no images available null is returned.

If type is specified, it will pick an image with the specified type and if no match is found null is returned.

fields.name: viewableWindowEnd
fields.description: Unix timestamp on which time this asset stops being published and playable

fields.name: collections
fields.description:
Linked collections

A set of collections related to the viewable.
Important note: This should not be queried from a collection view, but instead used only on detail pages.

fields.name: related
fields.description: This attribute fetches related viewables based on attributes of the viewable. It should not be called for collections as it could be rejected because of high complexity. It should instead be called for views that render an individual viewable and the related viewables, e.g a detail page

fields.name: tagsToRender
fields.description: Contains a list of tags to render about the viewable and if they are searchable or not.

types.name: Season
types.description: Season helper object

fields.name: seasonNumberUnique
fields.description:
An identifier to uniquely identify a season number in the partner universe.
 It cannot be used to query for a season and should only be used by frontends
 if they need to store seasons in a map-like data structure.

types.name: FeaturedCarouselCollection
types.description: Promote several assets in a carousel with a big 16:9 images. Works great as a top collection to promote the most exclusive content. The carousel can rotate on a fixed interval and by interaction from the user.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).
